chapters.title: Knowing Our Numbers
chapters.description: Learn about large numbers, place value, and number systems

lessons.title: Introduction to Large Numbers
lessons.content: In our daily life, we come across numbers in various forms. Let's explore how to read and write large numbers.

sections.heading: Place Value System
sections.text: Our number system is based on place values. Each position in a number has a specific value.

sections.heading: Reading Large Numbers
sections.text: We use commas to separate periods (ones, thousands, lakhs, crores) to make large numbers easier to read.
examples: 1,23,456 = One lakh twenty-three thousand four hundred fifty-six

keyPoints: Place value determines the value of a digit
Read numbers from left to right

practice.question: Write in numbers: Three lakh twenty-one thousand

lessons.title: Comparing Numbers
lessons.content: Learn how to compare large numbers and arrange them in ascending or descending order.

sections.heading: Comparing Two Numbers
sections.text: To compare numbers, start from the leftmost digit and compare place by place.
examples: 5,432 vs 5,234: Compare thousands (both 5), then hundreds (4 > 2), so 5,432 > 5,234

keyPoints: Compare digits from left to right
The number with more digits is usually larger

chapters.title: Whole Numbers
chapters.description: Understanding whole numbers and their properties

lessons.title: Introduction to Whole Numbers
lessons.content: Whole numbers include all natural numbers and zero (0, 1, 2, 3, ...).

sections.heading: What are Whole Numbers?
sections.text: Whole numbers are counting numbers starting from zero.
